headline: Airline stocks take off after American and Southwest raise targets
summary: A day after JetBlue Airways (JBLU) told investors that the end of the year was looking rather ascendant, a pair of its peers are doing the same. Stocks across the airline industry are leading the S&P 500 as American Airlines and Southwest Airlines both announced Thursday that they are raising their guidance for the end of 2024.

headline: Southwest Stock Rises as Airline Lifts Outlook on Strong Travel Demand
summary: Southwest Airlines shares rose Thursday morning after the airline became the latest to improve its revenue outlook, citing strong demand for travel heading into the holiday season.

headline: Southwest Airlines Lifts Q4 Guidance, Launches $750 Million Stock Buyback
summary: On Thursday, Southwest Airlines Company (NYSE:LUV) shares traded higher after the company announced it will launch a $750 million stock buyback program in the first quarter of 2025. The move follows the $250 million accelerated share repurchase launched in October 2024. After this, $1.5 billion will remain under its $2.5 billion repurchase program, authorized in September 2024. Outlook: The company revised its fourth-quarter guidance, now expecting RASM to increase by 5.5% to 7.0% (vs. 3.5%- 5.5

headline: Southwest lifts Q4 revenue outlook amid robust demand trends, shares rise
summary: Investing.com -- Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) revised its fourth-quarter revenue per available seat mile (RASM) forecast upward on Thursday, citing stronger pricing and a resurgence in domestic travel demand.

raw.headline: Southwest lifts Q4 revenue outlook amid robust demand trends, shares rise

headline: Southwest Airlines, American lift forecasts as holiday travel takes off
summary: U.S. carriers Southwest Airlines and American Airlines lifted their fourth-quarter forecasts on Thursday, betting on buoyant domestic travel demand during the holiday season and improved pricing.  Signaling a strong start to the travel season, the U.S. Transportation Security Administration said it had screened 3.08 million airline passengers on Sunday, the highest number ever on a single day.  U.S. airlines are set to fly more than 31 million passengers over the holiday period, up from nearly 29 million during the same period in 2023, according to trade association Airlines for America.
